abstracts.cdata!:
This program document proposes a
            Reengagement and Reform Support Program (RRSP) Grant to the
            Republic of Liberia. This RRSP supports the full
            normalization of relations between Liberia and the World
            Bank and the Government's efforts to establish a
            rigorous fiscal underpinning for the Liberian economy that
            will permit accelerated recovery and growth in the context
            of a multi-donor reengagement process. The proceeds of the
            grant will be disbursed (i) to support cash flow needs in
            the period immediately after Liberia has cleared its arrears
            to IBRD and IDA, and (ii) to meet immediate budgeted fiscal
            needs including future debt service obligations. The grant
            would assist the Republic of Liberia in its economic and
            social recovery underpinned by the government's Interim
            Poverty Reduction Strategy. This one-tranche operation would
            support government-owned reforms to improve the
            country's fiduciary environment and strengthen public
            institutions. It is an integral part of the Bank's
            Interim Strategy Note (ISN) for Liberia for the period 2007-2008.
